meanings.definition: Done, spoken, performed, etc., without special advance preparation; impromptu.
meanings.sent1: The extemporally speech surprised everyone with its spontaneity.
meanings.sent2: She gave an extemporally response to the unexpected question.
meanings.sent3: His extemporally decision to dance in the rain brought smiles to onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The extemporally composed music echoed through the empty hall.
meanings.sent5: The extemporally painted mural brightened the dull alleyway.

meanings.definition: Made, done, or spoken without special advance preparation; impromptu.
meanings.sent1: Their extemporally play impressed the audience with its creativity.
meanings.sent2: He delivered an extemporally speech at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The extemporally picnic in the living room was a fun surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her extemporally decision to take a different route paid off.
meanings.sent5: The extemporally decorated cake was a hit at the party.
